intro: Meineckia phyllanthoides subsp. somalensis, commonly known as the Somali meineckia, is a shrub native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its structure includes woody stems and small, thick leaves that help reduce water loss. It is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its resilience in harsh climates.
